file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 27-11-09-04 - KNURLED ANTI-SLIP RUBBER STRIP - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL KNURLED ANTI-SLIP RUBBER STRIP - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove and install the knurled anti-slip rubber strips of the LH and RH control wheels of the aileron control system. B. These procedures are applicable to the four knurled anti-slip rubber strips. C. The knurled anti-slip rubber strips are installed on the control wheels as follows: - LH control wheel: two knurled anti-slip rubber strips. - RH control wheel: two knurled anti-slip rubber strips. D. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY KNURLED ANTI-SLIP RUBBER STRIP - ALL 27-11-09-000-801-A REMOVAL KNURLED ANTI-SLIP RUBBER STRIP - ALL 27-11-09-400-801-A INSTALLATION EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 27-11-09 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 27-11-09-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. KNURLED ANTI-SLIP RUBBER STRIP - REMOVAL A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to remove the knurled anti-slip rubber strip of the control wheel of the aileron control system. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223 Cockpit 224 Cockpit C. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY To lock the aileron control system in the GSE 058 Kit, rig pins, flight controls neutral position D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) As nec- Commercially available Sandpaper essary As nec- Fed. Spec. ASTM-D-740 Methyl-ethyl-ketone essary F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit H. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) Install the rig pins to the aileron control system to lock it in the neutral position. I. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Remove the old knurled anti-slip rubber strip (1) and the old sealant from the control wheel (2). Use a plastic spatula. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-11-09 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (2) Sand the grip of the control wheel (2) with sandpaper. (3) Clean the grip of the control wheel (2) with a cloth soaked with methyl-ethyl-ketone. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-11-09 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL EFFECTIVITY: ALL Knurled Anti-Slip Rubber Strip - Removal/Installation Figure 401 B B A ZONES 223 224 C DET. A C DET. B (TYPICAL) 1. KNURLED ANTI-SLIP RUBBER STRIP SEALANT 2. CONTROL WHEEL DET. C (TYPICAL) 145AMM27247.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 27-11-09 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 27-11-09-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. KNURLED ANTI-SLIP RUBBER STRIP - INSTALLATION A. General (1) This procedure gives the instructions to install the knurled anti-slip rubber strip of the control wheel of the aileron control system. B. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 223 Cockpit 224 Cockpit C. Tools and Equipment ITEM DESCRIPTION PURPOSE QTY To lock the aileron control system in the GSE 058 Kit, rig pins, flight controls neutral position D. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable E. Consumable Materials SPECIFICATION DESCRIPTION QTY (BRAND) As nec- RTV157 Silicone rubber adhesive sealant essary As nec- JAN-P-127 Adhesive tape No. 250 (3M) essary F. Expandable Parts Not Applicable G. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit H. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Make sure that the knurled anti-slip rubber strip (1) is correct for the position at which it will be installed. NOTE: The knurled anti-slip rubber strip for the LH grip of the control wheel is different from the other for the RH grip of the same control wheel. (2) Apply sealant to the grip of the control wheel (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 27-11-09 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Put the knurled anti-slip rubber strip (1) on the grip of the control wheel (2). (4) Attach the knurled anti-slip rubber strip (1) to the grip of the control wheel (2) with adhesive tape. (5) Let the sealant cure for 24 hours. NOTE: Let the control-wheel-grip rubber strip cure for at least 2 hours. If after this time, the aircraft goes back to service before 24 hours (total curing time), under the operator's responsibility, the operator must protect the control- wheel-grip rubber strip with an anti-adherent tissue. Attach the anti-adherent tissue over the rubber strip with adhesive tape. (6) Remove the adhesive tape. (7) Apply a sealant fillet along the contour of the knurled anti-slip rubber strip (1). I. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) Remove the rig pins from the aileron control system. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 27-11-09 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
